snippet: Over all, the Chinese trade surplus shrank to $155 billion in 2011, from $183 billion in 2010, as imports picked up and demand for Chinese goods in Europe and elsewhere weakened.
abstract: Exports from China rose 13.4 percent in December compared with year-ago; import growth unexpectedly slowed to 11.8 percent, from 22.1 percent in November; overall, the Chinese trade surplus shrank to $155 billion in 2011, from $183 billion in 2010.
lead_paragraph: Over all, the Chinese trade surplus shrank to $155 billion in 2011, from $183 billion in 2010, as imports picked up and demand for Chinese goods in Europe and elsewhere weakened.

headline.seo: Chinese Exports Grow, but Imports Show Signs of Weakening
headline.main: Chinese Exports Grow, but Imports Show Signs of Weakening
headline.print_headline: Chinese Exports Grow, but Imports Show Signs of Weakening
